|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Samsung;K9F1208UOB-PCB0; |flash1size = 64 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes --> |flash2type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla2_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla2chip = Macronix;MX29LV800CTTC-70G; |flash2size = 1 |flash2maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->

|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Altima;AC101L; |sw1chip = Marvell;88E6060; |wan_ports = 2 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 3 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:90:7F |oui = 00:90:7F

|serial = yes,, 3.3V TTL |jtag = yes

|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = <!-- Radio module name, optional link, Leave blank for none --> |rad1modif = Mini PCI |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR2414A; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "4900T4000" is silkscreened on the main board. Has a 6th 10/100 BaseT Port labeled OPT.
Sample SSID patterns shown in the manual(s) are '''TRUSTED_XXXXX''' and '''WIRELESS_XXXXX''' (both with lower case hex digits). The main OUI used may be 00:90:7F (''WatchGuard Technologies'')
The wireless module is a [http://web.archive.org/web/20050226020546/http://www.video54.com/ Video54] (now ''[[Ruckus Wireless]]'') branded module.
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.watchguard.com/products/edge-e/compare.asp?p1=x55e&p2=x20e&p3=x10e Product page] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Watchguard_Firebox_Edge On the '''DD-WRT''' wiki]
